com.qivicon.featureflags.feature.group

Interface FeatureGroup

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Strategizable

    public interface FeatureGroup
extends Strategizable
    A feature group is defined by its name. Feature Groups are registered as OSGi services.

    Feature Group names getName() should be globally unique (case-insensitive). If multiple feature groups have the same name, the feature group with the highest service ranking is accessible through the FeatureService service while those with lower service rankings are ignored. If service rankings are equal, sort by service ID in descending order. That is, services with lower service IDs will be accessible whereas those with higher service IDs are ignored.

    This interface is intended to be implemented by feature providers.
    See Also:
    Feature, FeatureService, ActivationStrategy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<String> getDescription()
      The description of the feature group.
      String getName()
      The name of the feature group.
      Optional<String> getStrategy()

      boolean isEnabled()
      Checks whether the feature group is enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the feature group.
        Returns:
        The name of this feature group which must not be null or an empty string.

      • getDescription

        Optional<String> getDescription()
        The description of the feature group.
        Returns:
        The optional description of this feature group wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance

      • getStrategy

        Optional<String> getStrategy()
        The associated strategy identifier that will be used to check whether this feature group will be enabled or not.
        Returns:
        The strategy identifier of this feature wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Checks whether the feature group is enabled. If the feature group is enabled, all the features belonging to it, will by default be enabled. Hence, no associated strategy would be effective on belonging Features.

        To check enablement of any feature group, use FeatureService.isGroupEnabled(String).

        Returns:
        true if this FeatureGroup is enabled
